intro: Baeria aristata var. affinis, commonly known as the broad-leafed baeria, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lanceolate to ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and white to pale yellow, arranged in flat-topped clusters. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with deep roots and a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss.
